intro: Chlorophytum macrophyllum, commonly known as the Tiger's Tail or Tiger's Head plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its long, arching leaves that can grow up to 2 meters in length. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers in a spike that emerges from the base of the foliage. Its leaves are often marked with distinct yellow or white stripes, giving it its common name. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
